Target: OntoLandslide is an ontology developed to represent landslide hazard

Comment: A mass movement of earth, rock, or debris down a slope, typically caused by gravitational pull.
Label: Landslide

Comment: A potentially harmful event or phenomenon that may cause loss of life, injury, property damage, or environmental disruption.
Label: Hazard

Comment: A phase in the progression of a hazard event that represents a specific period in the hazardâ€™s lifecycle, from its initiation to its dissipation.
Label: Stage

Comment: The initial phase of hazard formation, where the necessary conditions for the event begin to develop.
Label: Embryonic Stage

Comment: The phase where the hazard starts gaining intensity and spreading.
Label: Growth Stage

Comment: The peak or most intense phase of the hazard, causing the most damage and destruction.
Label: Mature Stage

Comment: The phase where the hazard starts to weaken, dissipate, or recede, though residual impacts may persist.
Label: Decaying Stage

Comment: This property describes the different phases or stages that a hazard event undergoes.
Label: has Stage

Comment: This property indicates a temporal relationship where one event or stage occurs before another.
Label: preceded By

Comment: A relationship between an event and the time interval associated with the duration of the event.
Label: has TimeInterval

Comment: A hazard initiates or contributes to the occurrence of another hazard
Label: triggers

Comment: A relationship between an event and a geographic location
Label: has Location

Comment: Natural components of the environment (e.g. biodiversity, natural habitats, animal species, etc.).
Label: Environmental component

Comment: including humans and animals, that may be impacted by earthquakes.
Label: Living Being

Comment: People who inhabit a territory or state.
Label: Population

Comment: Non-human living organisms potentially affected by a hazard
Label: Animal

Comment: Manmade basic structures or features needed for the functioning of a system or organization.
Label: Infrastructure component

Comment: A relationship between a landslide and affected entities.
Label: affects

Comment: Hazards can contaminate water bodies, leading to pollution, reduced water quality, and harm to aquatic life.
Label: Water

Comment: Hazards can pollute air affecting air quality and leading to health issues in humans and ecosystem.
Label: Air

Comment: Hazards can contaminate soil, reducing soil fertility, harming plant growth, and posing risks to human and animal health through food chains.
Label: Soil

Comment: Hazards can damage or destroy plant life, reducing biodiversity, and disrupting ecosystem.
Label: Vegetation

Comment: Hazards can disrupt ecosystem balance to long-term environmental degradation.
Label: Ecosystem

Comment: Network systems, i.e. installations and facilities spreading across land.
Label: Network infrastructure

Comment: Areal installations and land-uses.
Label: Areal infrastructure

Comment: Network-shaped infrastructure to enable transport of people and goods (e.g. roads, railroads).
Label: Mobility network

Comment: Network-shaped infrastructure for provisioning goods (e.g. electricity, gas, water).
Label: Provisioning network

Comment: Material infrastructure in form of residential buildings.
Label: ResidentialArea

Comment: Material infrastructure in form of commercial buildings.
Label: CommercialArea

Comment: Material infrastructure in form of industrial buildings.
Label: IndustrialArea

Comment: Consequences of an event taking place.
Label: Impact

Comment: A relationship between an Event and its effects.
Label: results in

Comment: A relationship between an Impact and the quantification of its cumulative effects in monetary terms.
Label: has monetary value

Comment: This property links a hazard to the quantity representing the loss of life it causes.
Label: causes Loss Of Life Of

Comment: This property associates a hazard with the quantity representing the number of evacuations it causes.
Label: causes Evacuation Of

Comment: This property connects a hazard to the quantity representing the entities it endangers.
Label: endangers Of

Comment: This property links a hazard to the quantity representing the damage it causes.
This property associates a quantity with the environmental component, population, or infrastructure component it indicates.
Label: indicates Quantity Of

Comment: A relationship between an affected Infrastructure Component and the corresponding area affected.
Label: has affected area

Comment: A notification issued based on predictive analysis or real-time monitoring indicating potential or imminent landslide risk in a specific area.
Label: Landslide alert or warning

Comment: Area for which a landslide warning or alert service is provided (i.e. area to which a landslide warning/alert applies).
Label: Landslide area

Comment: A collection of all previously issued landslide warnings and alerts.
Label: Landslide alert or warning history

Comment: A relationship between a Landslide Area and its collection of previous landslide warnings and alerts.
Label: has historical warning

Comment: A relationship between the collection of previous landslide warnings and alerts and their actual time series history.
Label: has time series

Comment: The potential impact of the landslide associated with a landslide warning/alert.
Label: Severity

Comment: Landslide alert/warning indicating that landslide is possible (i.e. one should be prepared).
Label: Landslide alert

Comment: Landslide alert/warning indicating that landslide is expected (i.e. immediate action required).
Label: Landslide warning

Comment: Landslide alert/warning indicating that the landslide warning is no longer active.
Label: Inactive Landslide Warning

Comment: Landslide alert/warning indicating that severe landslide is expected (i.e. danger to life).
Label: Severe landslide warning

Comment: A relationship between a Landslide Alert/Warning and its severity.
Label: has severity

Comment: A forecast of landslide risk providing the indication of potential landsliding a few days into the future.
Label: Landslide forecast

Comment: A measure of hazard potential defined by expected likelihood and forecasted impact.
Label: Risk level

Comment: The probability of a forecasted landslide event.
Label: Likelihood

Comment: The potential impacts of a forecasted landslide event.
Label: Potential impact

Comment: A computational model that predicts potential landslide events based on landslide, meteorological, and geographic data.
Label: Landslide Forecast Model

Comment: An object property that specifies that a LandslideDataset is derived from either a LandslideForecastModel or a MeteorologicalDataset.
Label: is Based On

Comment: A relationship between a landslide forecast and its anticipated risk.
Label: has risk level

Comment: A relationship between a risk level and the underlying likelihood.
Label: has likelihood

Comment: A relationship between a risk level and the underlying impact potential.
Label: has potential impact

Comment: A relationship between a Landslide Alert/Warning and the actual landslide event it refers to.
Label: warns about

Comment: A computational model that predicts potential landslide events based on landslide, meteorological, and geographic data.
Label: is Based On

Comment: A relationship between a (forecasted) event and its geospatial location.
Label: has location

Comment: A collection of structured data related to past and predicted landslide events
Label: Landslide Dataset

Comment: A dataset containing weather-related data.
Label: Meteorological Dataset

Comment: A structured collection of related data points used for analysis, modeling, or decision-making.
Label: Dataset

Comment: A measurable characteristic or attribute of an entity.
Label: Property

Comment: A geographic or environmental entity, that is being observed or analyzed.
Label: Feature Of Interest

Comment: A recorded value representing a property of a feature of interest, obtained through observation or sensors.
Label: Measurement

Comment: A device that detects and records environmental data for landslide monitoring.
Label: Sensor

Comment: A defined time period over which measurements or observations are aggregated or analyzed.
Label: Interval

Comment: An object property that associates a property with a specific time interval during which measurements are taken.
Label: has Measurement Interval

Comment: An object property that links a property to the sensor responsible for measuring it.
Label: is Measured By

Comment: An object property that connects a property to the corresponding measurement data.
Label: has Measurement

Comment: An object property that indicates that a LandslideDataset contains a specific property related to landslide measurements.
Label: contains Property

Comment: A data property that defines the starting time of a measurement event.
Label: measurement Starttime

Comment: A data property that defines the ending time of a measurement event.
Label: measurement Endtime

Comment: A factor that contributes to the occurrence of a landslide, either human or natural.
Label: Causal Factor

Comment: Human activities or actions that can trigger or influence landslides.
Label: Human Factor

Comment: Natural occurrences like earthquakes or rainfall that contribute to landslide events.
Label: Natural Factor

Comment: Human-induced slope modification that can increase landslide risk.
Label: Slope Excavation

Comment: The removal or destruction of vegetation, which can lead to landslides.
Label: Vegetation Destruction

Comment: The process of extracting minerals from the earth, which can destabilize slopes.
Label: Mining

Comment: The accumulation of water in reservoirs, potentially causing landslides.
Label: Reservoir Storage

Comment: The melting of ice or snow, which can saturate soil and cause landslides.
Label: Melting Ice Snow

Comment: Seismic activity that can trigger landslides due to ground shaking.
Label: Earthquake

Comment: Precipitation that can saturate soils and increase the likelihood of landslides.
Label: Rainfall

Comment: The erosion of riverbanks by flowing water, leading to slope instability.
Label: River Scouring

Comment: The underlying rock and soil structures that influence landslide susceptibility.
Label: Geological Formation

Comment: Identifies the causal factor responsible for a landslide.
Label: has Causal Factor

Comment: The geographical position where an event or entity is situated.
Label: Location

Comment: A record of past landslides including relevant data and time series.
Label: Landslide History

Comment: A sequence of data points measured at successive time intervals.
Label: Time Series

Comment: A digital vector storage format for storing the location, shape, and attributes of geographic features.
Label: Shape File

Comment: An entity that produces data, reports, or manages resources related to landslide events.
Label: Organization

Comment: A URL link that points to a file containing relevant information or data.
Label: File Url

Comment: Links an landslide occurrence to the location where it took place
Links an event to the geographic location where it occurred.
Label: has Location

Comment: Connects a location to its associated landslide history.
Label: has Landslide History

Comment: Associates landslide history with a time series of data points.
Label: has Time Series

Comment: Refers to the shapefile associated with a specific location.
Label: has Shape File

Comment: Indicates the geometric representation of a location.
Label: has Geometry

Comment: Identifies the organization that produced a shapefile.
Label: is Produced By

Comment: Points to the URL of the shapefile.
Label: has File Url

Comment: This property represents the latitude coordinate of a specific landslide location, expressed as a floating-point number.
Label: has Lat

Comment: This property represents the longitude coordinate of a specific landslide location, expressed as a floating-point number.
Label: has Lon

Comment: This property represents the timestamp of the most recent update related to the landslide situation.
Label: last Update On

Comment: Actions or measures taken in reaction to a landslide event.
Label: Response

Comment: Specific measures taken to mitigate or manage a landslide event.
Label: Response Action

Comment: A department or agency responsible for coordinating landslide response actions.
Label: Response Department

Comment: Planning and managing resources and actions during a landslide event.
Label: Response Logistics

Comment: Coordination of vehicles and equipment needed for landslide response.
Label: Mobility And Equipment Logistics

Comment: Organizing medical and rescue operations for landslide victims.
Label: Medical And Rescue Logistics

Comment: Allocation and transportation of necessary resources during a landslide event.
Label: Resource Logistics

Comment: A populated area that may be affected by landslides.
Label: Settlement

Comment: Represents governmental bodies involved in managing landslide risks and responses.
Label: Government

Comment: A group of people residing in an area potentially affected by landslides.
Label: Community

Comment: Healthcare facilities that provide aid to individuals affected by landslides.
Label: Medical Centre

Comment: Associates a landslide event with the response taken.
Label: has Response

Comment: Specifies the actions taken in response to a landslide.
Label: action Taken

Comment: Refers to the department responsible for the response.
Label: response By

Comment: Denotes the logistics used during the response to a landslide.
Label: used Logistics

Comment: A type of fast-moving landslide with high water content carrying mud and debris.
Label: Mudflow

Comment: A slow-moving flow of fine-grained materials saturated with water.
Label: Earthflow

Comment: A type of landslide characterized by the downward and outward rotation of slope materials.
Label: Slump - Rotational Slide

Comment: The slow flow of water-saturated soil down a slope, usually in cold climates.
Label: Solifluction

Comment: A very slow form of soil landslide caused by continuous downhill movement of soil particles.
Label: Soil Creep

Comment: Any landslide involving the movement of soil as the primary material.
Label: Soil Landslide

Comment: A type of landslide where rocks move down a slope along a flat plane.
Label: Translational Rock Slide

Comment: A fast-moving landslide where rocks fall freely from a cliff or slope.
Label: Rockfall

Comment: A type of landslide where rocks dominate the mass movement.
Label: Rocky Landslide

Comment: A fast-moving, mixed-material landslide that includes a variety of debris and rock.
Label: Debris Avalanche

Comment: A very fast landslide where loose debris flows down a slope with a high water content.
Label: Debris Flow

Comment: Represents the geological or soil layers where landslides occur.
Label: Slope / Soil / Geological Layer

Comment: The amount of water present in a material, influencing the type and speed of landslides.
Label: Water Content

Comment: A landslide involving a mixture of different types of materials, such as rocks and soil.
Label: Mixed Lithology Landslide

Comment: Represents the speed at which the landslide moves, with the value being a float.
Label: has Velocity

Comment: Indicates the slope, soil, or geological layer on which a landslide occurs.
Label: occurs On

Comment: Individuals affected by or responding to a landslide event.
Label: Person

Comment: Professionals with knowledge and expertise in landslide management and prediction.
Label: Expert

Comment: Individuals who spread information about landslides through social media platforms.
Label: Social Media Worker

Comment: A person living in an area at risk of landslides.
Label: Resident

Comment: Indicators that signal the potential for an imminent landslide.
Label: Alert or Warning Sign

Comment: A damaged underground utility line caused by or contributing to landslides.
Label: Broken Underground Utility

Comment: A tilted electric pole, often a sign of slope instability or landslide activity.
Label: Leaning Electric Pole

Comment: A visible crack on a wall indicating possible ground movement or instability.
Label: Crack On Wall

Comment: A crack on a sidewalk surface, often a precursor to more severe ground movement.
Label: Crack On Side Walk

Comment: A tilted telephone pole caused by ground movement or slope instability.
Label: Leaning Telephone Pole

Comment: A crack forming on a street surface, indicating possible subsurface instability.
Label: Crack On Street

Comment: Structural cracks on a building, possibly caused by ground movement or a landslide.
Label: Crack On Building

Comment: A raised area of land indicating ground movement or subsurface pressure.
Label: Bulge On Ground

Comment: A sign of water contamination that may signal underground movement or landslides.
Label: Tap Water Color Changed

Comment: Rising water levels indicating possible landslide-triggering conditions.
Label: Increase In Water Level

Comment: A specific location identified as being prone to landslide activity.
Label: Landslide Spot

Comment: A historical record of warnings issued for landslides in a given area.
Label: Landslide Warning History

Comment: The landslide alert or warning
Label: landslide alert or warning

Comment: The intensity or magnitude of a landslide event.
Label: Severity

Comment: A notification or alert issued to warn of potential landslide occurrences.
Label: Landslide Alert

Comment: A warning issued based on predictive models or observed conditions.
Label: Landslide Warning

Comment: A warning indicating an imminent and potentially devastating landslide.
Label: Severe Landslide Warning

Comment: A warning issued for a past landslide event that is no longer active.
Label: Inactive Landslide Warning

Comment: Refers to the person who reported a warning sign.
Label: reported By

Comment: Indicates the landslide that the warning sign is about.
Label: warns About

Comment: Links a warning sign to its severity level.
Label: has Severity

Comment: Associates a landslide spot with its current warning sign.
Label: current Warning Sign

Comment: Links a landslide spot to its warning history.
Label: has Warning History

Comment: Associates landslide warning history with a time series of warning data.
Label: has Warning Time Series
